titleStmt.title: A whipp for the animadverter in return to his second libell. By R. L'S.
titleStmt.author: L'Estrange, Roger, Sir, 1616-1704.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A47940 of text R217627 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing L1325A). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 14 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 5 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A whipp for the animadverter in return to his second libell. By R. L'S.
titleStmt.author: L'Estrange, Roger, Sir, 1616-1704.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Henry Brome, at the Gun in Ivy-lane,

notesStmt.note: A reply to "A second letter unto a person of honour & quality, containing some farther animadversions upon the Bishop of Worcester's letter" both by Edward Bagshaw.
Caption title on p. 3 reads: An ansvver to a libel, &c.
Reproduction of the original in the Jesus College Library, Cambridge.

keywords.term: Bagshaw, Edward, 1629-1671. -- Second letter unto a person of honour & quality, containing some farther animadversions upon the Bishop of Worcester's letter.
